Articles.Content:
regarding the term DLC and it's relation to the add on content of games. as i have been playing an increasing amount of pc games recently, I have found that most of the core games i have played were in fact downloaded content. this brings me to suggest a change: to add an additional downloadable content label, something like ADLC (additional downloadable content) to specify whether or not that the software in question is a standalone product or a supplementary one. I realize that this is just nitpicking but I think that a change of label is needed, what are the rest of the community's opinions?

what i meant by "standalone" was that certain content downloaded off the internet is, itself a functioning product and "supplementary" means that the product adds to or upon another existing product. the reason i am posting this here is because as a forum dedicated to a game whose Contents were DownLoaded via the internet, i thought other people might have something to say on the matter.

Edited July 11, 2014 by Nothing But Rubus
clarification

Or just add new functionality in regular updates like a reasonable human being, and go back to making proper expansion packs for huge additions (or be nice and add huge additions into the game anyway)

I'm not sure what you meant by "standalone" vs "supplementary" though. DLC by present definition is always something that adds onto the game, in general stuff like weapon or map packs.
